alert.note: Alert for Barbour (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 2:58PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Barbour County through 330 PM CST... At 258 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Blue Springs State Park, or near Clio, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clio, Louisville, Tyler Crossroads, Texasville, Richards Crossroads, Blue Springs State Park, Millers Ford and Baker Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southeastern Alabama.
